skill.name: router

skill.summary: Intelligent routing layer that analyzes requests and directs them to the most appropriate Skills, Ag...
skill.author: AdamManuel-dev

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation skill with no executable code, file access, network calls, or command execution. Contains only routing patterns, workflow templates, and communication guidelines.

content.value_statement: Complex development tasks require choosing the right tool from many options. The Router skill intelligently analyzes your request and routes it to the best available Skill, Agent, or Command with transparent explanations.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes user intent from natural language requests
Routes to optimal Skills, Agents, or Commands
Coordinates multi-step sequential and parallel workflows
Calculates confidence scores for routing decisions
Handles ambiguous requests with clarification prompts
Manages emergency fast-path routing for critical issues
limitations: Does not execute code or modify files directly
Depends on available tools being installed
Routing accuracy depends on pattern matching rules

use_cases.title: Learn the Ecosystem

use_cases.title: Save Time on Tool Selection
use_cases.description: Experienced developers skip the discovery phase with intelligent routing that matches requests to specialized tools

use_cases.title: Coordinate Complex Workflows
use_cases.description: Multi-step workflows like feature development, security audits, and refactoring are orchestrated automatically

output: Found 5 TypeScript errors across 2 files in your recent changes

best_practices: Describe what you want to accomplish, not the specific tool
Mention context like file paths or modules to improve routing accuracy
Use urgency keywords like URGENT or CRITICAL for emergency routing
Provide follow-up clarification when asked to improve future routing
anti_patterns: Requesting vague help without specifying the goal or domain
Expecting the router to execute code or modify files directly
Using the router when you already know the exact tool you need
Ignoring clarification prompts that request additional context

faq.question: Does the router execute code or modify files?
faq.answer: No. The router analyzes requests and invokes other tools. It does not directly execute code or modify files.

faq.question: What happens if routing confidence is low?
faq.answer: The router asks clarifying questions to understand your intent better before making a routing decision.

faq.question: Can I use the router with custom tools?
faq.answer: The router routes to installed tools. Custom tools need to be properly registered to be routable.

faq.question: How does the router learn and improve?
faq.answer: The router tracks successful routes and user corrections to improve pattern matching over time.

faq.question: Does the router access my project files?
faq.answer: The router can gather context like git status and file types to inform routing decisions.

faq.question: How is this different from slash commands?
faq.answer: Slash commands require knowing the exact command. The router lets you describe what you want and finds the right tool.
